intro: Rotheca nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Rotheca nudiflora is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
